text: hi all! i have a couple of functions that contain a lot of recursive calls to each other, some of them have multiple methods. it's about 500 lines of code. compilation took something like 15 minutes on 1.5, and since i updated to 1.6 i  have not yet seen it terminate. execution (on 1.5) was super fast. i used MLStyle.jl @match, which afaiu generates even more multi-method functions; replacing some of the @match'es improved things a bit but even 15 minutes is a lot of minutes for not that much code. i remember reading something about the typechecker struggling with recursion in some cases? any other ideas?

text: if i use `julia --compile=min`  it's super fast
